Media.MediaTitle: lung cancer, non-small cell, stage IIA

ImageData.LabelName: Part or all of the lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis
Primary tumor is larger than 4 cm but not larger than 5 cm

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Change label above the inset to say “Inner membrane covering the lung" per expert reviewer
Move 4 cm circle under the lime
Changed the wording in the top inset on the right to say “Primary tumor is larger…5 cm”; and added a label for Pleura on the bottom left side of the figure
No additional changes made to image

Changed the title to Stage IIA Lung Cancer; removed the letter “a” from the inset; changed the letter “b” in the main figure to “a” and moved it up above the place where the left main bronchus comes in; changed the letter “c” in the inset to a “b”; changed the letter “d” in the main figure to a “c”; changed the label “Part or all of the lung has collapsed” to “Part or all of the lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis”; and removed the “d.” in front of the label.
Revisions made to image per AJCC 8th edition staging
Made the bone structure the same in both panels.

Diagnoses.Diagnosis: stage IIA non-small cell lung cancer

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IIA lung cancer; drawing shows a primary tumor (larger than 4 cm but not larger than 5 cm) in the left lung and cancer in (a) the left main bronchus and (b) the inner membrane covering the lung (inset). Also shown is (c) part or all of the lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis (inflammation). The carina, pleura, and a rib (inset) are also shown.

Stage IIA lung cancer; drawing shows a primary tumor (larger than 4 cm but not larger than 5 cm) in the left lung and cancer in (a) the left main bronchus and (b) the inner membrane covering the lung (inset). Also shown is (c) part or all of the lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis (inflammation). The carina, pleura, and a rib (inset) are also shown.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IIA lung cancer. The tumor is larger than 4 centimeters but not larger than 5 centimeters. Cancer has not spread to the lymph nodes and one or more of the following may be found: (a) cancer has spread to the main bronchus, but has not spread to the carina; and/or (b) cancer has spread to the inner membrane that covers the lung; and/or (c) part of the lung or the whole lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis (inflammation of the lung).

Stage IIA lung cancer. The tumor is larger than 4 centimeters but not larger than 5 centimeters. Cancer has not spread to the lymph nodes and one or more of the following may be found: (a) cancer has spread to the main bronchus, but has not spread to the carina; and/or (b) cancer has spread to the inner membrane that covers the lung; and/or (c) part of the lung or the whole lung has collapsed or has pneumonitis (inflammation of the lung).

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage IIA non-small cell lung cancer
